abstract: Brazilian Federal Court convicts first group of high-level construction-industry executives tied to vast price-fixing and bribery scandal involving Petrobras, state-run oil company; finds three Camargo Correa chiefs, Dalton dos Santos Avancini, Joao Ricardo Auler and Eduardo Hermelino Leite, guilty of money laundering, corruption and other charges; rules same day Federal Police formally accuse Odebrecht chief executive Marcelo Odebrecht of participating in scandal.
lead_paragraph: Three executives of Brazil’s Camargo Correa group were convicted Monday on money laundering, corruption and other charges.

headline.main: Brazil: Three Executives Are Guilty of Graft in Petrobras Scandal
headline.print_headline: The America; Brazil: Three Executives Are Guilty of Graft in Petrobras Scandal
